skills.name: Interpret remainders from written division problems

explanations.A: We need a whole number of teachers. Does r6 make sense in this context?
explanations.B: 321 ÷ 7 = 45 r6 = 45 and 6/7 = 45.857... This means 321 students can be split into 45 groups of 7 and 1 group of 6. Having 45 teachers would leave the group of 6 without a teacher. So we need 46 teachers.
explanations.C: We need a whole number of teachers. Is it possible to have 6/7 of a teacher?
explanations.D: Not quite, think carefully about which way we need to round our answer. Is 45 x 7 more than the number of children?

explanations.A: We need a whole number of crates. Does r7 make sense in this context?
explanations.B: Not quite, think carefully about which way we need to round our answer. Is 54 x 8 more than the number of tins of paint?
explanations.C: We need a whole number of crates. Is it possible to have 7/8 of a crate?
explanations.D: 439 ÷ 8 = 54 r7 = 54 and 7/8 = 54.875. This means 439 tins of paint can be split into 54 groups of 8 and 1 group of 7. Having 54 crates would leave the group of 7 unpacked. So we need 55 crates.

explanations.A: 473 ÷ 6 = 78 r5. This means 473 apples can be split into 78 whole packs and 1 pack of 5 apples. We are only interested in whole packs. This means the answer is 78.
explanations.B: We are looking for the number of whole packs. Should our answer be a whole number or a decimal?
explanations.C: Not quite. I think you have included a partial pack in your answer.
explanations.D: Not quite, this is the answer to 473 ÷ 6. We are looking for the number of whole packs. Should our answer be a whole number or a decimal?

explanations.A: 823 ÷ 4 = 205 r3. This means 823 tyres can be split into 205 groups of 4 and 1 group of 3. Each car needs 4 tyres and so we only count the groups of 4. This means the answer is 205.
explanations.B: We are looking the number of cars that can be refitted with a complete set of 4 tyres. Does r3 make sense in this context?
explanations.C: Not quite. I think you have included a partial set of tyres in your answer.
explanations.D: We are looking for the number of complete sets of tyres. Should our answer be a whole number or a decimal?

explanations.A: This is the correct, exact value but you cannot buy a quarter of a drink in a shop, so how many can Dave buy?
explanations.B: I think you have used the remainder as your answer but the quotient is how many drinks Dave can buy...
explanations.C: 17 ÷ 4 = 4.25 which shows Dave can buy 4 full drinks from the shop
explanations.D: I think you have incorrectly rounded your answer up. Do 17 ÷ 4 and the whole number is how many drinks Dave can buy...

explanations.A: I think you have used the remainder as your answer but the quotient is how many drinks Mark can buy...
explanations.B: 23 ÷ 3 = 7.67 which shows Mark can buy 7 full drinks from the shop
explanations.C: This is the correct, exact value but you cannot buy two thirds of a drink in a shop, so how many can Mark buy?
explanations.D: I think you have incorrectly rounded your answer up. Do 23 ÷ 3 and the whole number is how many drinks Mark can buy...

explanations.A: I think you have accidentally used the remainder as your answer but this would only give 10 hot dogs. How many packs does Gemma need to make 27?
explanations.B: I think you have rounded down but 5 packs would be 25 hot dogs, Gemma needs 27. How many packs does she need to buy?
explanations.C: This is the correct answer when doing 27 ÷ 5 however you cannot buy .4 of a pack of hot dogs so how many packs does Gemma need to buy?
explanations.D: 27 ÷ 5 = 5.4 so Gemma needs to buy 6 packs of hot dogs to have enough for her son's party.

explanations.A: 25 ÷ 8 = 3.125 so Addyson needs to buy 4 packs of hot dogs to have enough for her son's party.
explanations.B: This is the correct answer when doing 25 ÷ 8 however you cannot buy .125 of a pack of hot dogs so how many packs does Addyson need to buy?
explanations.C: I think you have rounded down but 3 packs would be 24 hot dogs, Addyson needs 25. How many packs does she need to buy?
explanations.D: I think you have accidentally used the remainder as your answer but this would only give 8 hot dogs. How many packs does Addyson need to make 25?

explanations.A: I think you have used the remainder as your answer but the quotient is how many strawberries each child gets...
explanations.C: This is the correct, exact value but you cannot have 0.75 of a strawberry so how many whole strawberries does each child get?
explanations.D: I think you have incorrectly rounded your answer up. Do 39 ÷ 4 and the whole number is how many strawberries each child gets...

explanations.A: This is the correct, exact value but you cannot have 0.8 of a strawberry so how many whole strawberries does each child get?
explanations.B: I think you have used the remainder as your answer but the quotient is how many strawberries each child gets...
explanations.C: I think you have incorrectly rounded your answer up. Do 44 ÷ 5 and the whole number is how many strawberries each child gets...
